I believe the test is failing due to the change in debug event dispatch. 
Events are not fired asynchronously, in a seperate thread. So, the target is 
created and continues executing, while a breakpoint is installed in a seperate 
job. This allows the target to complete executing before it has a chance to 
install the exception breakpoint.

Fixed in JDIDebugTarget.

* Since event listeners may want to perform synchronous "stuff" on CREATION of 
a debug target, the JDIDebugTarget now waits for the CREATION event to 
propogate before starting event dispatch (resuming the VM). The target listens 
for the event to come back to itself before starting event dispatch.
* Also modified AbstractDebugTest/ProjectCreationDecorator/MiscBreakpointTests 
to properly set/restore suspend preferences.
